Many Enlightenment philosophers viewed Machiavelli’s book as a satire meant to expose and caricature the _________ claims to power of the very figures Machiavelli pretended to endorse.
A.	sarcastic
B.	specious
C.	spurious
D.	squalid
E.	stolid
F.	stoic
